intro: Delphinium talyschense, commonly known as the Talyschense larkspur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. The plant produces showy, spurred flowers in shades of blue, purple, and white, typically blooming in late summer. Its leaves are compound, with lance-shaped leaflets that are arranged alternately along the stem. Delphinium talyschense is adapted to cold, alpine environments and is often found in rocky or meadow habitats at high elevations.
